## Concept note

::: {.columns style="display:flex; gap:1em;"}
::: {.column width="52%" .bg-blue}
**Purpose**

The Hub curates datasets, metadata, and reproducible code connecting democratic quality, psychological need dynamics, wellâ€‘being, and civic attitudes. It offers public aggregates for transparency and governed access for partner microdata.

:::{.callout-note title="Rationale"}
Democracies aim to create conditions for human flourishing, yet democratic discontent is rising. By mapping when systems support or thwart citizensâ€™ needs, we clarify why democracies sometimes enhance mental healthâ€”and why, under threat, citizens may prefer autocratic solutions.
:::
:::
::: {.column width="48%" .bg-blue}
**Scope**

* Datasets: crossâ€‘national surveys; national panels; experiments; validated short scales.

* Metadata: codebooks, translations, invariance reports, sampling frames, weights, changelogs.

* Analytics: preregistered pipelines for harmonization, SEM/MLM, experiments, visualization.

* Access: public aggregates + restricted microdata (DTA/DTUA).

* Governance: authorship/citation norms, ethics & GDPR templates, annual DOI releases.
